intro: Senecio triodon, commonly known as the three-toothed groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are usually narrow and have a serrated edge, while its flowers are small and yellow. Senecio triodon is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
